intro: Cinchona amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian quinine tree, is a species native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and striking red flowers. The plant is notable for its ability to produce quinine, a compound historically used in the treatment of malaria. Its bark contains alkaloids that have been traditionally harvested for medicinal purposes. Cinchona amazonica thrives in humid, shaded environments and is an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
